d.title: Persistent "This product is currently out of stock and unavailable." error on WooCommerce Products

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Product/Inventory Management
labels.description: Issues related to product or product page.

d.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug. - [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate. ### Describe the bug I've found a persistent bug in woocommerce where products in stock, out of the blue, stop showing the variations and instead display the following message: "This product is currently out of stock and unavailable." This issue occurs even when the product is, in fact, available in stock. The problem affects both variable and non-variable products, making it difficult to pinpoint the exact cause based on the solutions available online. The only temporary solution I've found so far is to edit the product, not make any changes at all, and click on update. Then the variations reappear. So far, this seems to have solved the problem with simple and variable products with just one attribute. But I have a category of variable products with two attributes, where I have seen this message reappear on a daily basis. I've also found a similar issue reported on the woocommerce plugin support page and seems to happen to many people from the comments: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/this-product-is-currently-out-of-stock-and-unavailable-10/ Also on the web: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24639288/woocommerce-products-showing-out-of-stock-message-when-not-actually-out-of-sto ### Expected behavior That my products with stock and variations remain as such. ### Actual behavior After a few days the product in the general grid doesn't show the "Out of stock" badge but when you enter the product page (single product) it shows the message "This product is currently out of stock and unavailable." ### Steps to reproduce I'd love to know, but I still don't know what's causing this error. BUT: 1. I have a suspicion... I don't know if it's at the end of a day, two days, or just a few hours. But I have an idea that when a customer buys this product, it shows the error "This product is currently out of stock and unavailable." straight afterwards, but I haven't checked this yet, it's a clue. 2. It seems to appear more in a product range that has two attributes than in the range that only has one attribute of variations, which has only happened once to date. ### WordPress Environment `### WordPress Environment ### WordPress address (URL): https://floresnocais.pt Site address (URL): https://floresnocais.pt WC Version: 9.2.1 Legacy REST API Package Version: The Legacy REST API plugin is not installed on this site. d.body:
Hi dear,

Recently I updated WooCommerce to version 4.4.1 and I found the widget filter products does not work correctly

**Prerequisites (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [x] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

**Describe the bug**
I use Storefront theme and run on WordPress 5.5 and WooCommerce 4.4.1, I create an attribute "Color" with three options "Blue, Grey, Red" and I create variable product and setup the same price for all product variations

**Expected behavior**
The widget need to work correctly

**Actual behavior**


**Steps to reproduce the bug (We need to be able to reproduce the bug in order to fix it.)**
Steps to reproduce the bug:
1. Go to 'WooCommerce -> Attributes' and create the "Color" attributes with three options  "Blue, Grey, Red"
2. Create a new product variable with these options
3. And then setup the variation like as screenshot
4. Go to Appearance -> Widgets and drop a "Widget Filter Products by attribute" in "Sidebar" area
5. Go to Shop page and see 

**Screenshots**

**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**

d.title: My Account edit-address endpoint text is missing "Addresses".

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: focus: i18n
labels.description: The issue/PR is related to internationalization.

labels.name: plugin: woocommerce
labels.description: Issues related to the WooCommerce Core plugin.

d.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

As we discussed in the WooCommerce WordPress Forums here: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/my-account-endpoint-text-addresses-in-turkish-is-missing/#post-16385202
There you can find out about this bug.

### Expected behavior

"Addresses" text from My Account 'edit-address' endpoint should show itself.

### Actual behavior

"Addresses" text from My Account 'edit-address' endpoint is missing.

### Steps to reproduce

https://prnt.sc/Yc3jj1pH3c4D Screenshot in Hebrew, as well in the forum Turkish and France same issue.
I tried everything as a front-end developer and full-stack co-developer.
Searched conflicts in themes and plugins as well as woocommerce plugin folder.

### WordPress Environment

Already rolled back version so i don't have this thing there.

### Isolating the problem

d.title: [Bug]: WP Admin notice for removing legacy coupon menu does not disappear after clicking "Remove legacy coupon menu" button

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: plugin: woocommerce
labels.description: Issues related to the WooCommerce Core plugin.

labels.name: Wayfinding
labels.description: Issues related to the inbox feature (not individual notes).

d.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug. - [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate. ### Describe the bug The WP Admin notice for "Coupon management has moved" does not get dismissed by pressing the "Remove legacy coupon menu" button. I was able to reproduce the issue on my test site, and I've put the steps to reproduce it below. A month back, I saw the same issue on my test site as well as on some of my old client's websites. I came across a similar issue today in 4727785-zen. I've recorded the steps that: 1) Does not reproduce the issue. 2) Reproduces the issue. ### Expected behavior The WP Admin notice for "Coupon management has moved" **should get dismissed** by pressing the "Remove legacy coupon menu" button. ### Actual behavior The WP Admin notice for "Coupon management has moved" **does not get dismissed** by pressing the "Remove legacy coupon menu" button. ### Steps to reproduce **Steps that reproduce expected results** 1) Install WooCommerce on a new WordPress site 2) Skip the installation wizard and go to **WooCommerce > Coupons** 3) Press on the "Remove legacy coupon menu" button once the WP Admin notice for Coupon management appears. 4) The notice gets dismissed. Video below. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92479346/151512861-753756d3-1050-44ce-b560-ab602e3270ef.mov **Steps that reproduce bug** 1) Install WooCommerce on a new WordPress site 2) Skip the installation wizard and go to **WooCommerce > Orders** 2) Now go to **WooCommerce > Coupons** 3) Press on the "Remove legacy coupon menu" button once the WP Admin notice for Coupon management appears. 4) The notice does not get dismissed. Video below. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92479346/151513708-9c6ae47f-1d9e-4b45-b98f-71d7e155f0b3.mov ### WordPress Environment ` ### WordPress Environment ### WordPress address (URL): d.title: Order details page not displaying variation/attribute name

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

d.body:
The other bug report for this was closed incorrectly and is being ignored, but the bug is very much present.

On numerous of my client's sites, the order details do not say the variation's name in the title. I've tested this on WC 3.2.6 and 3.8, they both have the same issue. Occasionally it'll display the variation's name, and occasionally not. I can't work out why this happens sporadically. 

**To Reproduce**
Check your order details. If it's happening to several of our sites it'd presumably appear on yours too. 

The below screenshots are 2 separate stores. You can clearly see there's a variation ID, but no variation name in the title. I'm getting angry emails from my clients and I haven't a clue what to suggest:
[https://i.imgur.com/oqfZ13r.png](https://i.imgur.com/oqfZ13r.png)
[https://i.imgur.com/5OlvvgQ.png](https://i.imgur.com/5OlvvgQ.png)

**Expected behavior**
...that it'd say what the variation is in the title. 

**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [x] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

I'm leaving out the status report as this is affecting numerous WC instances on different versions/themes/etc. It's everywhere.

d.title: Fix incorrect net sales in analytics product reports for partial and full refunds

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: plugin: woocommerce
labels.description: Issues related to the WooCommerce Core plugin.

labels.name: Reports/Analytics
labels.description: Issues related to analytics section.

labels.name: needs: analysis
labels.description: Indicates if the PR requires a PR testing scrub session.

d.body:
### Submission Review Guidelines:

-   I have followed the [WooCommerce Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [WordPress Coding Standards](https://make.wordpress.org/core/handbook/best-practices/coding-standards/).
-   I have checked to ensure there aren't other open [Pull Requests](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pulls) for the same update/change.
-   I have reviewed my code for [security best practices](https://developer.wordpress.org/apis/security/).
-   Following the above guidelines will result in quick merges and clear and detailed feedback when appropriate.

<!-- You can erase any parts of this template not applicable to your Pull Request. -->

### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:

<!-- If necessary, indicate if this PR is part of a bigger feature. Add a label with the format `focus: name of the feature [team:name of the team]`. -->

<!-- Describe the changes made to this Pull Request and the reason for such changes. -->

Part of the epic issue #50480, this PR fixes current WC analytics inconsistent net sales for **partial** and **full** refunds.
Those fixes were tested and reviewed in #48768 and #51262, ~so technically this umbrella PR doesn't require a lot of detailed testing~.

**Update 5th March 2025**

After a long back and forth reviews and fixes, this PR actually solves the problems not specifically to the inconsistent net sales between product and order reports, but the product reports itself by making the table `wp_wc_order_product_lookup` display every amount correctly when the partial and full refunds happen. Before those fixes, there were no record in the table `wp_wc_order_product_lookup` when refunds.

✏️ Note that there were still cases where net sales are inconsistent between product and order reports, such as the issue #56096. In this PR we are focusing on fixing the product reports (`wp_wc_order_product_lookup` table).

Closes #32837 #48761 #48775.

#### Next steps

There is still an issue #48954 that is part of the epic issue #50480 need to be fixed.

<!-- Begin testing instructions -->

### How to test the changes in this Pull Request:

<!-- Include detailed instructions on how these changes can be tested. Review and follow the guide for how to write high-quality testing instructions. -->

Using the [WooCommerce Testing Instructions Guide](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/wiki/Writing-high-quality-testing-instructions), include your detailed testing instructions:

1. Follow the steps in #48768 and #51262, the inconsistent net sales should not occur for partial and full refunds.

d.title: WC 6.5 RC: The Automattic\WooCommerce\Admin\API\Options::get_options function is deprecated since version 3.1.

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: plugin: woocommerce
labels.description: Issues related to the WooCommerce Core plugin.

d.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

Looks like core is producing a deprecation notice in WC 6.5 RC.

The Automattic\WooCommerce\Admin\API\Options::get_options function is deprecated since version 3.1.

I traced this to user_has_permissions check on API calls from the settings page.

We confirmed this happens even if we only have WC enabled.

### Expected behavior

No deprecation notices :)

### Actual behavior

Deprecation notice :)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Enable WC 6.5
2. Go to WooCommerce > Settings
3. Check the PHP error log

The Automattic\WooCommerce\Admin\API\Options::get_options function is deprecated since version 3.1.

### WordPress Environment

n/a

### Isolating the problem

- [X] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [X] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

d.title: Notifications won't go away after clicking their button

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Wayfinding
labels.description: Issues related to the inbox feature (not individual notes).

d.body:
**Prerequisites (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [x] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

**Describe the bug**
The notifications at the top won't go away after clicking their buttons:
"Coupon management has moved!"
"WooCommerce database update done"

I clicked their buttons many times, nothing happened.
I cleared cache, loged out, deleted cookies, cleared browser cache.

**Expected behavior**
The notification should go away after you click them once.

**Actual behavior**
The notifications at the top won't go away after clicking their buttons

**Steps to reproduce the bug (We need to be able to reproduce the bug in order to fix it.)**
Steps to reproduce the bug:
This started after updating to the WC 4.4.1
Using PHP 7.4.9

**Screenshots**
https://ibb.co/hBjgzr3


**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [ ] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [ ] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [ ] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

d.title: 7.8.1 introduces a fatal error regarding wc_get_default_product_type_options during tracking

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Product/Inventory Management
labels.description: Issues related to product or product page.

labels.name: status: reproduction
labels.description: Bug reports that need to be reproduced and confirmed.

d.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

At the moment, I don't have too much but I wanted to raise the flag as soon as possible.

Since 7.8.1 was launched, our end to end tests are failing with this error message:
`PHP Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Call to undefined function wc_get_default_product_type_options() in wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/tracks/events/class-wc-products-tracking.php:242`

This didn't happen with WC 7.8

I'm guessing this won't be noticeable to users because tracking happens in the background.

### Expected behavior

I expect no error

### Actual behavior

We get a fatal error

### Steps to reproduce

I started with a fresh WC install and storefront (with its sample products).

One way to trigger the error is to publish a product outside of the admin context (the missing function seems to be loaded only in admin).

For example, with: `wp wc product create --name=testing --regular_price=50 --user=admin`

I'm getting:
```
Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Call to undefined function wc_get_default_product_type_options() in wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/tracks/events/class-wc-products-tracking.php:242
Stack trace:
#0 wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/tracks/events/class-wc-products-tracking.php(259): WC_Products_Tracking::get_possible_product_type_options_ids()
#1 wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/tracks/events/class-wc-products-tracking.php(311): WC_Products_Tracking::get_product_type_options(75)
#2 wp-includes/class-wp-hook.php(308): WC_Products_Tracking->track_product_published(75, Object(WP_Post), false, NULL)
#3 wp-includes/class-wp-hook.php(332): WP_Hook->apply_filters('', Array)
#4 wp-includes/plugin.php(517): WP_Hook->do_action(Array)
#5 wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/tracks/events/class-wc-products-tracking.php on line 242
```

d.title: Import products: Import fails with a security notice for CSV files

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

d.body:
**Describe the bug**

When importing a products CSV file on the native WooCommerce products importer, it fails with a `Sorry, this file type is not permitted for security reasons.` notice.

**To Reproduce**

- Start with a WooCommerce site 
- Visit `{domain}/wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=product&page=product_importer`
- Select a CSV file from computer. [Example file from WooCommerce's GitHub](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/master/sample-data/sample_products.csv)
- Optionally choose to `Update existing products`
- Click `Continue`

**What is expected**

The importer works

**What happens instead** 

The import fails with a `Sorry, this file type is not permitted for security reasons.` notice.

**Screenshots**

![screenshot 2018-12-13 at 12 39 55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18581859/49921817-c7002f00-fed4-11e8-8f4c-bbd57df8fd0f.png)

**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [x] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

**WordPress Environment**

d.title: 8.6.0. causes fatal error with Woo Subscriptions's subscription details area

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Reports/Analytics
labels.description: Issues related to analytics section.

d.body:
**For visibility:** For this issue, you can disable Order Attributes setting and the fatal error should go away. “WooCommerce > Settings > Advanced > Features > Order Attributes”

![7XbQvVC3mMJJhi4Ye67KxxGReJmdZK5Pyn6PH6kU.jpg](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/assets/85893744/5a49c024-6db3-48bb-a79e-cb4906037ab3)

More here: https://woo.com/document/order-attribution-tracking/#section-2

### Prerequisites

- [x] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [x] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

When you update to the WC version 8.6.0 and you have Woo Subscriptions extension, then you see the fatal error when trying to check subscription order: 

![OYAB7V9L3ySupOWv77qia0soX12pbfT7aDeSTjpq.jpg](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/assets/85893744/ef6dbee6-1c8a-432e-8049-ecba0ee4a53f)

Fatal error recorded:

> 2024-02-16T01:04:13+00:00 Critical Uncaught Error: Call to undefined method WC_Subscription::get_report_customer_id() in /srv/htdocs/wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/src/Internal/Admin/Orders/MetaBoxes/CustomerHistory.php:28 CONTEXT: {"error":{"type":1,"file":"\/srv\/htdocs\/wp-content\/plugins\/woocommerce\/src\/Internal\/Admin\/Orders\/MetaBoxes\/CustomerHistory.php","line":28},"backtrace":["","#0 \/srv\/htdocs\/wp-content\/plugins\/woocommerce\/src\/Internal\/Admin\/Orders\/Edit.php(271): Automattic\\WooCommerce\\Internal\\Admin\\Orders\\MetaBoxes\\CustomerHistory->output(Object(WC_Subscription))","#1 \/wordpress\/core\/6.4.3\/wp-admin\/includes\/template.php(1456): Automattic\\WooCommerce\\Internal\\Admin\\Orders\\Edit::Automattic\\WooCommerce\\Internal\\Admin\\Orders\\{closure}(Object(WP_Post), Array)","#2 \/wordpress\/core\/6.4.3\/wp-admin\/edit-form-advanced.php(707): do_meta_boxes(Object(WP_Screen), 'side', Object(WP_Post))","#3 \/wordpress\/core\/6.4.3\/wp-admin\/post.php(206): require('\/wordpress\/core...')","#4 {main}","thrown"]}

### Expected behavior

You should be able to view the subscription order in admin page.

### Actual behavior

You are not able to view the subscription order details. 

### Steps to reproduce

- Have WC 8.6.0
- Have Woo Subscriptions active

Does not matter if you have HPOS enabled or not enabled. 
Does not matter which version of Woo Subscriptions.

d.title: "Changes you made may not be saved." message when leaving product, even if no changes have been made

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: status: awaiting upstream
labels.description: Upstream issue that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: Product/Inventory Management
labels.description: Issues related to product or product page.

d.body:
**Prerequisites (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [x] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

**Describe the bug**
After opening up a product from **Products > All Products** list, then trying to browse to a different page, it will pop up the alert saying "Changes you made may not be saved." even if you haven't made any changes.

Only see it on WooCommerce 4.8.0
Initially reported in forums here: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/weird-behaviour-after-recent-wordpress-5-6-update/
Didn't see it when I was on 4.7.1, but saw it occur after updating to 4.8.0, then was able to reproduce on a fresh install of WordPress and WooCommerce, with Storefront.

**Expected behavior**
It should only display that alert if you have made changes to the product. If there are no changes, it should let you move to other pages without any alert.

**Steps to reproduce the bug (We need to be able to reproduce the bug in order to fix it.)**
Steps to reproduce the bug:
1. Go to **Products > All Products**, and open a product to edit.
2. Without making any changes, click on a different link in menu
3. See the alert saying that changes may not be saved:

![Screenshot](https://d.pr/i/W6ewgh+)
Screenshot direct link: https://d.pr/i/W6ewgh

**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [x] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

**WordPress Environment**
We use the [WooCommerce System Status Report](https://docs.woocommerce.com/document/understanding-the-woocommerce-system-status-report/) to help us evaluate the issue. 
Without this report we won't be able to fully evaluate this issue.

d.title: Unable to retrieve tax rate row when buyer's country has a county with a space in it

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

d.body: **Describe the bug** Certain countries (e.g. GB) have counties which are treated as states for the purposes of things like tax rates. If you attempt to create an entry in the tax table for such a county, and that county includes spaces in its name (e.g. Isle of Wight), after saving the tax rate table, the state code loses its spaces (e.g. becomes ISLEOFWIGHT) Unfortunately, this means that buyers that enter "Isle of Wight" for their County during checkout will NOT see the tax rate you have set up for them in the tax table. (Not surprisingly, if they enter ISLEOFWIGHT in the checkout form, that works.) **Screenshots** **Expected behavior** A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. **Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):** - [x] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active. - [x] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/). - [x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above. **WordPress Environment** WooCommerce 3.7 RC1

d.title: Fatal Error around strpos in BlockPatterns.php

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Blocks/Patterns/Templates
labels.description: Issues related to Full Site Editing

d.body:
# Bug

Some sites might see a fatal error around class `BlockPatterns.php`, with the website not loading. This was due a bad response from Woo pattern repository. A fix was deployed to the repository but **certain sites** might still have a bad cache value.

# Fix

Updating to 9.8.4 will fix the issue.

# Workaround

Sites seeing this fatal can fix it by removing this transient `ptk_patterns` via WP CLI if that's still accessible to you or from the database directly.
```
 wp --skip-themes --skip-plugins transient delete ptk_patterns
```

or deleting `_transient_ptk_patterns` from the DB: (change the `wp_` prefix to your db prefix)
```
DELETE FROM wp_options WHERE option_name = '_transient_ptk_patterns';
```

If you can't edit the database, modifying `plugins/woocommerce/src/Blocks/BlockPatterns.php` and adding this inside `parse_categories` will fix it:

```php
	/**
	 * Parse prefixed categories from the PTK patterns into the actual WooCommerce categories.
	 *
	 * @param array $patterns The patterns to parse.
	 * @return array The parsed patterns.
	 */
	private function parse_categories( array $patterns ) {
		if ( ! isset( $patterns['categories'] ) || ! is_array( $patterns['categories'] ) ) {
			return array();
		}
```

The issue has been fixed from the cache source side but certain sites were left with a bad cache value, we will be releasing patch updates to fix that.


## **Describe the bug**

We are seeing a fatal error that just popped up very recently we have at least 5 sites that have gone down in our queues.

d.title: WooPayments shows in the admin menu without being installed

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Payments
labels.description: Issues related to payments.

labels.name: needs: developer feedback
labels.description: Issues that need feedback from one of the WooCommerce Core developers.

labels.name: Payments Engineering
labels.description: WooCommerce Payments, WooCommerce Subscriptions and WooCommerce Stripe

d.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [X] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

### Describe the bug

Since the last WooCommerce update, I have noticed WooPayments (FKA WooCommerce Payments) now mysteriously appears in the admin menu as if I have the plugin installed when I do not.
![image](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/assets/123473359/bcd510b0-4830-458d-8dc1-8633ea0a7428)

This seems a very a covert way of advertising the plugin on sites which use different payment gateways. You can see I don't have WooPayments installed, yet a menu item with a notification bubble to draw attention to it conveniently appears.
![image](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/assets/123473359/5ca02a28-429b-485a-b118-7af023db7817)


### Expected behavior

Not to see an admin menu item for a plugin that is not installed.

### Actual behavior

I see the WooPayments menu item as if I have the plugin installed. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to your WordPress admin dashboard
2. Navigate around a bit
3. BAM! WooPayments mysteriously appears
4. It will then disappear randomly and appear again depending on where you are on the dashboard.

I am able to recreate this on 3 stores

Here is the link to the page, all you need is WooCommerce installed:
/wp-admin/admin.php?page=wc-admin&path=%2Fwc-pay-welcome-page

d.title: Variable Product: Thumbnail Toggle Not Working Correctly in Product Gallery (iOS & Android)

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: Store Frontend
labels.description: Issues related to shop page.

labels.name: plugin: woocommerce
labels.description: Issues related to the WooCommerce Core plugin.

labels.name: Kirigami
labels.description: WC Store Editing (FSE)

d.body:
**Prerequisites (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have have carried out troubleshooting steps and I believe I have found a bug.
- [x] I have searched for similar bugs in both open and closed issues and cannot find a duplicate.

**Describe the bug**

_Detected on:_
iOS (Version 14.0). 
Chrome (Version 85.0.4183.109). 
TwentyTwenty (Version 1.5).

When product type "Variable Product" is used, touch stops working for thumbnails in product gallery. This prevents toggling between gallery images using touch.

Sometimes toggling works, but this requires interaction with the gallery first.

Similar issues has been addressed in 2018:
https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/20002

**Expected behavior**

Thumbnail toggle for product gallery images should work consistently on any device & with all product types.

- Toggle product gallery images by clicking on thumbnails for Desktop.

- Toggle product gallery images by touch on thumbnails for Mobile.

**Actual behavior**

- Thumbnail toggle for product gallery images work consistently for product type "Simple Product" on both mobile & desktop.

- Thumbnail toggle for product gallery images does not work consistently for product type "Variable Product". Works on desktop. Not as expected on mobile.

**Steps to reproduce the bug**

1. Create a Variable Product type with variations, see guide: https://docs.woocommerce.com/document/variable-product/ 
/* Remember to add price for each variation (if you do not add price for each variation the product gallery toggle will still work using touch) */
2. Set a product image
3. Set a gallery image
4. Use iPhone 7 or later with latest iOS version together with latest release of Chrome or Safari.
5. Find your Variable Product in the shop & load the Single Product page. 
6. Scroll down to the product gallery thumbnails. 
/* Do not interact with any other page element as this can make the toggling work */
7. Try to toggle between images using touch. 
/* Thumbnails are detecting touch but do not toggle the images in the product gallery */

**Wordpress Test Environment**

NO ACTIVE PLUGINS. ONLY WOOCOMMERCE. CLEAN WP INSTALL WITH THEME GeneratePress.

This show the difference in behavior on product gallery between "Simple Product" & "Variable Product".
https://staging2.immerence.com/product-category/all-posters/

**Isolating the problem (mark completed items with an [x]):**
- [x] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [x] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.
